Articles.Content:
Does anyone else have issues with orbital missions that will not complete?

My AP is 8,477,000

(wanted by mission is 8,484,221)

My PA is 8,275,000

(Wanted is 8,270,000)

[https://imgur.com/a/kPiG3#1](https://imgur.com/a/kPiG3#1)

I cannot get it to complete the mission. What are my options other than cancelling the mission and taking a hit? Is there a way to edit the file to give it a 'complete' status so I can get my $$$ ?

I suspect you are going the wrong way.

Mouse over the AN (ascending node) or DN (descending node) marker and see what it says. If it says 180Ã‚Â° or something close to it, then you are indeed going the wrong way, and you will need to reverse your orbit in order to complete the mission.
The dots that are spinning around the edge of the orbit indicate the direction of the orbit. Are you going with them, or against them?

You guys are right.

I never noticed that there was an orbital path (left to right or right to left).

I'm travelling in the reverse direction, and I won't have enough fuel to reverse it all, as I have wasted it all trying to get it as exact as possible.

Another flight launch it is! 

TY all!

- - - Updated - - -

If I were to convert this post into a suggestion, Your "Own" orbit should have the little thingies flyin around it to show what direction you are orbiting too.

Our own thingies would be too distracting - at least for me.

Maybe a small arrow in front of your craft?

I've fallen victim to directional orbit, myself, once or twice but, I've been able to live with it thus far.
